description:
Yet another customizable audio visualizer.

[h1]Features[/h1]
[list]
[*] [b][u]Customizable background[/u][/b]
    You can use a solid color, a local image or image folder, or some custom CSS [i][url=https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background]background[/url][/i].

[*] [b][u]Customizable visualizer[/u][/b]
    Several different types of visualizer. You can change color, position, size, alignment, and much more.

[*] [b][u]Spotify integration[/u][/b]
    This is still [b]experimental[/b], so shƒ±t can happen and things could go [i]boom[/i].
    This functionality requires you to obtain an access token from [url=https://aleab.github.io/acav-we/token]here[/url]. A simplified version of the auth server's source code is available [url=https://github.com/aleab/acav-we-server]here[/url], so in case things do go [i]boom[/i] you can self-host the server wherever you want, even in a Docker container, and keep using this functionality.

[*] [b][u]iCUE support[/u][/b]

[*] [b][u]This whole project is open source![/u][/b]
    https://github.com/aleab/acav-we
[/list]

en-us.ui_$_audioSamples: The following filters are applied sequentially in the order they are listed here.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_buffer: How many seconds of samples to buffer for normalization and smoothing purposes.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_scale_Exponential:
n‚Äâ<‚Äâ2: Reduces higher values.
n‚Äâ>‚Äâ2: Increases higher values.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_scale_Gaussian:
The default settings emphasize mid-high values.
Low values of ùúé tend to isolate and increase values close to ùúá and squash everything else down.
The most usable values are 0.4‚ÄØ‚â§‚ÄØùúé‚ÄØ‚â§‚Äâ0.5 and ùúá‚ÄØ‚â•‚ÄØ0.8.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_scale_Logarithm:
b‚Äâ<‚Äâ2: Increases mid values.
b‚Äâ>‚Äâ2: Reduces higher values.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_scale_Logarithm$Power:
Increasing a increases the contribution of the logarithm vs the power function.
The default settings make this function behave almost like x2, but with low values less squashed and slightly lower peaks.
en-us.ui_$_audioSamples_scale_Power:
n‚Äâ<‚Äâ1: Increases all values, especially lower ones, flattening the whole spectrum.
n‚Äâ>‚Äâ1: Squashes lower values down.
en-us.ui_$_clock_digital_locale: A BCP 47 language tag; unicode extension are supported: documentation.
en-us.ui_$_icue_spectrum_start:
The index of the first audio sample to use.
¬†
en-us.ui_$_icue_spectrum_width:
The amount of audio samples to use.
¬†
en-us.ui_$_spotify_art_fetch_local:
Experimental
Use an external provider (musicbrainz.com) to fetch cover arts of local files.
en-us.ui_$_spotify_art_fetch_local_note:
Local files must contain album and artist(s) metadata, which should match as closely as possible the information provided by musicbrainz.com, especially in regard to romanized names and titles; proximity, fuzzy and partial searches will be performed nonetheless in order to always find the best match.
MusicBrainz's terminology
- recording: a song
- release-group: an album, single, etc.
- release: a specific version/issuing of an album, single, etc.
en-us.ui_$_spotify_token: To use Spotify's overlay you need an access token. You can request a token here.
en-us.ui_$_spotify_token_note: Note: Including your token in shared presets won't leak any potentially private information nor will it let other users use your access token (AT). The token is encrypted and only valid for a couple of minutes until it is exchanged (behind the scenes) for an actual AT, which is then saved in your device's local storage.
en-us.ui_$_visualizer_color_responseDegree: Mathematical degree of the root of P used to control the sensitivity, or spread in some way, of the effect.
en-us.ui_$_visualizer_color_responseProvider:
This defines which parameter or characteristic P of the audio samples to use to determine the amount of effect to apply to the color of each bar.
Value: the (normalized) value of the current sample.
Value Change: the (absolute) difference between the current sample and the oldest one in the buffer.
en-us.ui_$_visualizer_color_responseRange:
The intensity of the effect, i.e. the difference between the maximum and minimum possible values of the color component(s) involved after the effect has been applied to the base color.
Example: for a base color with lightness 75, and a range of 35, the effect will produce a color with lightness 100 when the sample value is 1 (maximum) and 65 when the sample value is 0 (minimum).
en-us.ui_$_visualizer_color_responseType: This option controls what kind of transformation to apply to the color of each bar.
en-us.ui_audioSamples_buffer: Buffer Length (s)*
en-us.ui_audioSamples_correct: Correct Samples*
en-us.ui_background_$_css: Only the background‚Äë* style properties and the background shorthand are allowed.
en-us.ui_note1:
[1] Graphical comparison of the scaling functions.
[2] Graphical visualization of the smoothing function.
en-us.ui_note2:
[3] Color spaces comparison and conversions.
¬†

title: Customizable Audio Visualizer
